skill.name: skill-installer
skill.description: Install Codex skills into $CODEX_HOME/skills from a curated list or a GitHub repo path. Use when a user asks to list installable skills, install a curated skill, or install a skill from another repo (including private repos).

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and AI behavior instructions. No executable code, scripts, or network calls are included in this skill. The referenced helper scripts are external dependencies that Codex would execute, not part of this skill package.

content.user_title: Install Codex skills from curated list
content.value_statement: Users need to discover and install new skills for Codex but lack an easy way to browse available options and add them. This skill provides a unified interface to list curated skills and install them from OpenAI's official repository or any GitHub source including private repos.
actual_capabilities: List all available curated skills from OpenAI's official repository
Show which skills are already installed vs available
Install skills from the curated list with one command
Install skills from any GitHub repository including private repos
Support both direct download and git sparse checkout methods
Handle multiple skill installations in a single operation
limitations: Does not include the actual installation scripts - requires Codex to execute external Python scripts
Cannot install skills from non-GitHub sources
Does not update or upgrade already installed skills
Does not uninstall or remove skills from the system

use_cases.title: Browse available skills
use_cases.description: Discover what skills are available in the curated collection before deciding which ones to install

use_cases.title: Install custom skills
use_cases.description: Add skills from private GitHub repositories or forks with custom configurations

use_cases.title: Bulk install skills
use_cases.description: Install multiple related skills at once using path arguments for efficient setup

prompt_templates.scenario: User wants to install from a custom repo

output_examples.input: What skills are available to install?
output: Which ones would you like installed?

best_practices: Use the curated list first to ensure skills are vetted and compatible with your Codex version
Restart Codex after installing new skills to ensure they are loaded properly
Use git credentials or tokens for private repository access to avoid authentication errors
anti_patterns: Installing skills without checking if they are already present
Installing system skills that are preinstalled and not meant for user installation
Using arbitrary GitHub repositories without verifying the skill source and content

faq.question: Which platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with OpenAI Codex. It is not compatible with Claude or standard Claude Code installations.

faq.question: How many skills can I install at once?
faq.answer: You can install multiple skills in one command by providing multiple --path arguments. The limit depends on your system resources.

faq.question: Can I use this with private GitHub repos?
faq.answer: Yes. Use existing git credentials or provide a GITHUB_TOKEN or GH_TOKEN environment variable for authentication.

faq.question: Is my data safe when installing skills?
faq.answer: This skill only reads skill listings and downloads files to your local Codex skills directory. No personal data is transmitted to external servers.

faq.question: Why did the installation fail with an auth error?
faq.answer: For private repos, ensure git credentials are configured or provide a valid GitHub token. The skill falls back to git sparse checkout if direct download fails.

faq.question: How is this different from Claude Code components?
faq.answer: This skill installs Codex-specific skills for OpenAI Codex. Claude Code uses a separate components system for agents, commands, and settings.
